data.description: The initial layer flow is the amount of material that needs to be extruded on the initial layer over a specific amount of time and is based on the filament diameter and print speed. The flow is always set to 100%, which means that the extruded amount of filament will match the calculated amount.
data.hints: - This setting is not usually changed, as the calculation is done automatically, but it can be useful when printing with experimental materials which need better build plate adhesion.
